body: Trying to find an analogy I imagine what would be if the "conflicting" fields would not be exported in a Go program (unless you use tags; the behaviour we currently have on the json package).  That would pretty much suck isn't it? I think it's the same case for the encoding process as the conflicting fields are not encoded unless you use tags, thus it makes the  development of JSON enabled services more laborious and prone to errors.
